Author: gravitywolf
Content:
@Terd Fergasen There are a lot of similarities between Java, and C++/C/C# (Probably because java is written in C++ and C); however, EnforceScript has concepts from both languages, and they are used in the same way. Things like your basic programming concepts, conditionals, looping, collections and arrays, primitive data types, objects, classes...I think I could go on for quite a while.

You don't need to learn any other languages before you learn EnforceScript, actually I feel it would be best for you to learn enforcescript in its "buggy" state, you would be able to create something in a world which you could also interact with instead of printing `hello world` to a console for hours. I don't think anyone is "struggling" with the language, others can choose to speak up for themselves, it is just learning the built-in functions, and other things built into the API. 

Personally, I look things up whenever I have questions, but it's never because of syntax errors. Just read the files that are stored inside of the scripts.pbo, which is packaged with your game.

If anyone would like to add, or correct me by all means.
